paragraphs.text: Sony scraps 'The Interview': Dark day for America when we cave over silly Seth Rogen comedy.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: Exactly what country are we living in?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: How the hell could Sony give in to the demands of terrorists?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And make no mistake about it... The hackers who broke into their computer systems are just that: Terrorists
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Sony is a commercial enterprise
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it has the prerogative to scrap the release of "The Interview."
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Sony is also the face of the United States in this heated relationship with North Korea
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the United States doesn't negotiate with terrorists
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Neither should Sony
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It's a dark day for America when we cave over a simple, silly Seth Rogen comedy
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It's embarrassing
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It's humiliating
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It's exactly what these hackers wanted
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it creates an open season for anarchists
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I can' t help but think of that brilliant scene in Steven Spielberg's much maligned but hilarious World War II comedy "1941," (1979)
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: when
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Toshiro Mifune, playing a Japanese submarine commander, is under orders to destroy Hollywood from off the coast of Los Angeles
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Mifune beams with pride after destroying the Ferris wheel at the Santa Monica pier
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: He thinks his mission is a success
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: He thinks he's conquered America
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: just as North Korea probably thinks it has conquered us
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But in a way it has
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Have at it, guys
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: Sony has just created a ridiculous, yet dangerous, precedent
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Watch the first episode of the brilliant British series "Black Mirror"(which debuted in 2011 and is currently streaming on Netflix) to see just how this situation played out and will continue to play out within our society
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In the episode, a British princess is kidnapped, and the ransom demand calls for the prime minister to go on live television and have sex with a pig
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The world stops
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: the masses are enthralled
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: the news and social media go to town with the juicy fodder
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Some cheer the prime minister's humiliation
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: some are disgusted
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: some are apathetic
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: But beneath it all, society is brought to its knees
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: -- and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the Twitterverse welcomes it
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: because
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it is a damn good spectacle
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: "Black Mirror" -- the first episode, especially -- was incredibly prescient
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Sony Pictures' "The Interview" is just a movie
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: It may be just a stupid comedy
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it is still a work of expression -- free expression!
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: -- something that separates us from them
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: George Washington said,"If the freedom of speech is taken away, then dumb and silent we may be led, like sheep to the slaughter."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: For anyone to silence our creative voice is just wrong
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Laughably wrong
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: That is why Sony should not buckle to the pressure of these vile threats
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I understand that people may have been afraid to go to the big chain theaters to see "The Interview,"
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: I respect their desire to protect themselves and their families
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Sincere props, though, to the Alamo Drafthouse in Dallas/Fort Worth for announcing they would show the equally controversial film "Team America: World Police" (2004) in place of "The Interview."
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: Thursday afternoon, Paramount announced that they would not publicly screen the movie
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Sony should seriously consider releasing the Seth Rogen-James Franco (and phenomenal Lizzy Caplan) comedy on-demand for a number of reasons
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: One
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Sony and all involved will get their incredible payday
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Has any recent film received more free hype than "The Interview"?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Two
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: No theater will be harmed
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: even though
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: theaters will lose potential revenue from the film
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Three: Most importantly
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Sony -- and we, the United States -- will not give in to this ludicrous and obnoxious threat from an impotent and juvenile country
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This is America
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: We stand by our freedom
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Even if it's a stupid comedy
paragraphs.label: assumption
